intro: Lamourouxia nelsonii, commonly known as the Nelson's lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking white and pink petals. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and requires a cool, moist environment to thrive. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, Lamourouxia nelsonii is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
